N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7202.8 - Requests for public access to records

State Regulations
(a) All requests shall be made in writing, except that the privacy compliance officer may, in his discretion, accept oral
requests after the applicant has demonstrated proof of identity. (b) All requests shall reasonably describe
the record or records sought. Whenever possible, the data subject shall supply
identifying information that assists the commission in locating the records
sought. (c) Within five business
days of the receipt of a request, the privacy compliance officer shall: (1)
provide access to the record; (2)
deny access in writing, explaining the
reasons therefor; or
(3)
acknowledge the receipt of the request in writing, stating the request will be
granted or denied, within 30 days from the date of the
acknowledgment. Notes
